org.codice.ddf.admin.application.service

Interface Application

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ApplicationImpl

    public interface Application
    This class defines an application within DDF. An application is a component that can contain multiple features. Inside each one of those features can be one or more bundles.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<org.apache.karaf.features.Feature> getAutoInstallFeatures() 
      Set<org.apache.karaf.features.BundleInfo> getBundles()
      Gets all of the bundles that this application contains.
      String getDescription()
      Short description of the application.
      Set<org.apache.karaf.features.Feature> getFeatures()
      Gets the features that this application contains.
      org.apache.karaf.features.Feature getMainFeature()
      If applicable, returns the single feature in the application that is auto-started.
      String getName()
      Name describing the application.
      URI getURI()
      Retrieves the URI for the underlying application.
      String getVersion()
      Version of the application

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Name describing the application.
        Returns:
        name

      • getVersion

        String getVersion()
        Version of the application
        Returns:
        version

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Short description of the application.
        Returns:
        description

      • getURI

        URI getURI()
        Retrieves the URI for the underlying application. This is the location of the application's descriptor files which are used to identify its location.
        Returns:
        URI of the location

      • getFeatures

        Set<org.apache.karaf.features.Feature> getFeatures()
                                            throws ApplicationServiceException
        Gets the features that this application contains. This includes all features inside the application regardless if they are auto-started, required or optional.
        Returns:
        Set of the features located within the application
        Throws:
        ApplicationServiceException

      • getMainFeature

        org.apache.karaf.features.Feature getMainFeature()
        If applicable, returns the single feature in the application that is auto-started. By definition, this feature is considered to be the main one that, in-turn, starts the rest of the application in the correct order.
        Returns:
        Main feature that is auto-started, null if no such feature exists.

      • getBundles

        Set<org.apache.karaf.features.BundleInfo> getBundles()
                                              throws ApplicationServiceException
        Gets all of the bundles that this application contains. These bundles are defined inside of the features.
        Returns:
        Set of the bundles located within the application.
        Throws:
        ApplicationServiceException

      • getAutoInstallFeatures

        Set<org.apache.karaf.features.Feature> getAutoInstallFeatures()
